item.title: Abandoned vehicle. Been sprayed and number plates remoced, 12th October
item.description:
This vehicle has been resprayed and had the number plates removed front and rear. It has no MOT and is an eyesore on our street. It leaks oil and is neglected and in ruin. Please have it removed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kenilworth Road, Poverest, London

item.title: Unacceptable Lake view, 12th October
item.description:
I have lived on Gadwall way for over 7 years where residence and children enjoy the view of the lake, people sit on the bench right in front of lake and see docks, birds and fish swim in front of the beautiful conservatory. A while ago the residence were lied to that beautiful flowers will be planted in the water front to make the water cleaner, and that in the summer time it would beautify the view of the lake and also provide the best environment. Ever since the lake was restructured all we see in front of our house as residence is grown wheats and smell of a canal with dead fish in the lake which was contrary to what we were told when the front of the lake on Gadwall way was going to be reconstructed. It appears the purpose of changing the look of the view of the lake from what it used to be must have been because the council or those responsible for the idea must have done so for the benefit of people coming from far for fishing games at the other side of the lake adjacent to the Gallions park, and it appears there was no consideration given to the health, safety and the environment of us living in front of the lake from the other side of Gadwall way (SE28 0DB). Since the lake side was reconstructed, the residence of Gadwall way hardly go outside of the house to play or sit idown by the conservatory front of the lake as people usually do with their family and kids before, and the lake smells so badly with the sights of dead fish which made it horrible and parent can no longer take the kids to play in front of the house anymore. Whoever came up with this idea had cut off all the residence of Gadwall way from enjoying the beautiful view of the lake and the environment and they had intentionally built a canal right infront of the residence. I believe they must have done this without given any consideration to the health and wellbeing.of those of us living right in front of the lake. I think something urgently needs to be done about it because it makes some of us living in the neighbourhood very sick anytime we walk close to the lake and see dead fish in the lake. It is an horrible view especially for children walking pass the front of the lake to school. It is very wrong and unfair for the local authority to allow this to happen as we were sent a letter telling us the refurbishment is to make the environment beautiful and safe. Even in the nights now the residence in Gadwall way cannot go close or sit in front of the lake because of fear for their own life. People we see coming to sit in front of the lake in the night are group of men from outside the area and some of them covering their faces at night and you can hardly see them from inside the house because the wheat had grown so much and had completely covered the view of the lake. I fear one day something very tragic will happen if nothing is done to prevent it now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fishermans Walk, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of shopping trolleys and household waste dumped on tge grass in the corner and opposite, 12th October
item.description:
This has been here for months and the collection is getting bigger, something needs to be done, cctv maybe? It is usually cleared and within a couple of months it slowly starts building up again. These people are lazy and have no pride in the area they live in.

item.title: Street cleaning, 12th October
item.description:
Ceres Road again is absolutely filthy. The road has not been cleaned thoroughly for weeks now. A joining Kashgar Road is also the same. Fallen leaves clog up the kerbside, previous grey leaf collection bags still on roadside uncollected on Ceres Road Fly tipping mess scattered bottom Ceres Road adjoining Kashgar road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ceres Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: Fridge, wardrobe, pallets, garbage bags, 12th October
item.description:
This fly tipping has been here for 5 months. I reported 2 months ago and nothing ha been made, the problem just increase (wooden pallets and garbage bags are there noe). I saw foxes there in the evening, it's becoming their home soon. I'm desperate, struggling to understand who to report to solve it. My next step will be to take it to the local newspaper, it s already become public health issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Quebec Way, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gazebo frame dumped, 12th October
item.description:
14 Paston Close had a gazebo up. Now their gazebo is gone + the frame of a gazebo has been dumped on the green next to their house. This was dumped at some point on Saturday 11 October, as it was not there on Saturday morning
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Paston Close, Hackney, London

item.title: 11/10/25 - Near 10 Shortlands Rd, Shortlands, the Width Limit rectangular blue warning sign is rotated about 80 degrees away from approaching traffic., 12th October
item.description:
11/10/25 - Near 10 Shortlands Rd, Shortlands, the Width Limit rectangular blue warning sign is rotated about 80 degrees away from approaching traffic. Please find a permanent solution as this has been reported about 5 times in 3 years eg put a pair of bolts through the pole and sign. My apologies for mixing up this width limit sign with the Low Bridge sign nearby. The Low Bridge sign has been straightened up. The Width Limit sign repair still needs doing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shortlands Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.description:
